intro: Tuberaria variabilis var. viscosopuberula, commonly known as the sticky-hairy tuberaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is characterized by its glandular, hairy stems and leaves, which often produce a sticky secretion. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it distinctive within its genus, particularly its viscid (sticky) surface and variable morphology.
